column2: Allow ssh to the Admin Instance
The ID of the VPC you will start the instance into
DNS Name of the newly created Admin EC2 instance

{u'Fn::Base64': {u'Fn::Join': [u'', [u'#!/bin/bash
', u'# Helper function
', u'function error_exit 
', u'{
', u'/usr/local/bin/cfn-signal -e 1 -r "$1" '', {u'Ref': u'AdminServerWaitHandle'}, u"'
", u'exit 1
', u'}
', u'STATUS=0
', u'#Update OS to latest , cfn tools installation & AWS CLI
', u"apt-get -y update || error_exit 'Failed to apt-get -y update'
", u"apt-get -y install python-pip || error_exit 'Failed To Install python-pip'
", u"pip install awscli || error_exit 'Failed To pip install awscli'
", u'cd /home/ubuntu/
', u'mkdir aws-cfn-bootstrap-latest
', u'curl https://s3.amazonaws.com/cloudformation-examples/aws-cfn-bootstrap-latest.tar.gz | tar xz -C aws-cfn-bootstrap-latest --strip-components 1
', u'easy_install aws-cfn-bootstrap-latest
', u'#Lets start to build the environment for the demo
', u'export S3BUCKET=', {u'Ref': u'ArtifcatsS3Bucket'}, u'
', u'export REGION=', {u'Ref': u'AWS::Region'}, u'
', u'echo $S3BUCKET >> /tmp/env
', u'echo $REGION >> /tmp/env
', u'#Calling cfn-init to parse and install the above metadata section
', u'/usr/local/bin/cfn-init -s ', {u'Ref': u'AWS::StackId'}, u' -r AdminEc2Instance ', u'    --region ', {u'Ref': u'AWS::Region'}, u" || error_exit 'Failed to run cfn-init check cfn logs'
", u'#Copying Artifacts to s3 bucket
', u'cd /home/ubuntu/
', u"curl -O https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/kbitpub/ec2-chefsolo-demo/solo-all.tar.gz || error_exit 'Failed To download solo-all'
", u"curl -O https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/kbitpub/ec2-chefsolo-demo/solo-all.tar.gz.md5 || error_exit 'Failed To download solomd5'
", u"curl -O https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/kbitpub/ec2-chefsolo-demo/roles.tar.gz || error_exit 'Failed To download roles.tar.gz'
", u"curl -O https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/kbitpub/ec2-chefsolo-demo/roles.tar.gz.md5 || error_exit 'Failed To download roles.tar.gz.md5'
", u"curl -O https://www.opscode.com/chef/install.sh || error_exit 'Failed To download install.sh (chef-solo)'
", u"aws s3 cp solo-all.tar.gz s3://${S3BUCKET}/cookbook/ --region $REGION || error_exit 'Failed to upload solo-all.tar.gz'
", u"aws s3 cp solo-all.tar.gz.md5 s3://${S3BUCKET}/cookbook/ --region $REGION || error_exit 'Failed to upload solo-all.tar.gz.md5'
", u"aws s3 cp install.sh s3://${S3BUCKET}/others/ --region $REGION || error_exit 'Failed to upload install.sh'
", u"aws s3 cp bootstrap.sh s3://${S3BUCKET}/others/ --acl public-read --region $REGION || error_exit 'Failed to upload bootstrap.sh'
", u"aws s3 cp solocron.sh s3://${S3BUCKET}/others/ --region $REGION || error_exit 'Failed to upload solocron.sh'
", u"aws s3 cp roles.tar.gz s3://${S3BUCKET}/roles/ --region $REGION || error_exit 'Failed to upload roles.tar.gz'
", u"aws s3 cp roles.tar.gz.md5 s3://${S3BUCKET}/roles/ --region $REGION || error_exit 'Failed to upload roles.tar.gz.md5'
", u"mkdir /home/ubuntu/solorb || error_exit 'Failed to create solorb'
", u"mkdir /home/ubuntu/nodejson || error_exit 'Failed to create nodejson'
", u"chown ubuntu.ubuntu /home/ubuntu/ -R || error_exit 'Failed to chown /home/ubuntu/ -R'
", u'# All is well so signal success
', u'/usr/local/bin/cfn-signal -e 0 -r "Bootstrap has ended successfully" '', {u'Ref': u'AdminServerWaitHandle'}, u"'
"]]}}
VPC Subnet-ID (Must be Public Subnet which assigns PUBLIC IP to newly launched EC2 Instance)
The ARN of the IAM Instance Profile for the bootstrapped instance
The Security Group ID for the bootstrapped instance
Generate hidden files to be used as arguments for the bootstrap scripts
[{u'ToPort': u'22', u'FromPort': u'22', u'IpProtocol': u'tcp', u'CidrIp': u'0.0.0.0/0'}]
Name of an existing EC2 KeyPair to enable SSH access to the instance

[{u'SubnetId': {u'Ref': u'SubnetID'}, u'DeviceIndex': u'0', u'GroupSet': [{u'Fn::GetAtt': [u'AdminInstanceSecurityGroup', u'GroupId']}], u'DeleteOnTermination': u'True', u'AssociatePublicIpAddress': u'True'}]
Name of your S3 Bucket that will store the artifacts (CFN will create and populate the bucket)
